Detailed Description

This class provides access to the system location services.

These services allow applications to obtain periodic updates of the device's geographical location, or to fire an application-specified Demand when the device enters the proximity of a given geographical location.

gaia::base::String gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::getBestProvider ( const Criteria &  criteria,
bool  enabledOnly 
)

Returns the name of the provider that best meets the given criteria.

Only providers that are permitted to be accessed by the calling activity will be returned. If several providers meet the criteria, the one with the best accuracy is returned. If no provider meets the criteria,

GpsStatus* gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::getGpsStatusN ( const GpsStatus *  status)

Retrieves information about the current status of the GPS engine.

This should only be called from the GpsStatus.Listener#onGpsStatusChanged callback to ensure that the data is copied atomically.

The caller may either pass in a GpsStatus object to set with the latest status information, or pass null to create a new GpsStatus object.

Parameters:
statusobject containing GPS status details, or null.
Returns:
status object containing updated GPS status.
Location* gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::getLastKnownLocationN ( const gaia::base::String &  provider)

Returns a Location indicating the data from the last known location fix obtained from the given provider.

This can be done without starting the provider. Note that this location could be out-of-date, for example if the device was turned off and moved to another location.

If the provider is currently disabled, null is returned.

Parameters:
providerthe name of the provider
Returns:
the last known location for the provider, or null
static const gaia::base::String& gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::GPS_PROVIDER ( ) [static]

Name of the GPS location provider.

This provider determines location using satellites. Depending on conditions, this provider may take a while to return a location fix.

bool gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::isProviderEnabled ( const gaia::base::String &  provider)

Returns the current enabled/disabled status of the given provider.

If the user has enabled this provider in the Settings menu, true is returned otherwise false is returned

static LocationManager* gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::LocationManagerFactory ( ) [static]

Retrieve LocationManager instance through LocationManagerFactory().

static const gaia::base::String& gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::NETWORK_PROVIDER ( ) [static]

Name of the network location provider.

This provider determines location based on availability of cell tower and WiFi access points. Results are retrieved by means of a network lookup.

Requires either of the permissions gaia.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or gaia.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION.

bool gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::operator== ( const LocationManager &  other) const

Compare to another LocationManager instance.

Returns:
true they are the same.
static const gaia::base::String& gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::PASSIVE_PROVIDER ( ) [static]

A special location provider for receiving locations without actually initiating a location fix.

This provider can be used to passively receive location updates when other applications or services request them without actually requesting the locations yourself. This provider will return locations generated by other providers. You can query the Location#getProvider() method to determine the origin of the location update.

void gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::removeUpdates ( const LocationListener &  listener)

Removes any current registration for location updates of the current activity with the given LocationListener.

Following this call, updates will no longer occur for this listener

void gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::requestLocationUpdates ( const gaia::base::String &  provider,
int64_t  minTime,
float  minDistance,
const LocationListener &  listener 
)

Registers the current activity to be notified periodically by the named provider.

Periodically, the supplied LocationListener will be called with the current Location or with status updates. The calling thread must be a thread such as the main thread of the calling Page.

void gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::requestLocationUpdates ( const gaia::base::String &  provider,
int64_t  minTime,
float  minDistance,
const gaia::core::PendingDemand &  intent 
)

Registers the current activity to be notified periodically by the named provider.

Periodically, the supplied PendingDemand will be broadcast with the current Location or with status updates. The calling thread must be a thread such as the main thread of the calling Page.

void gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::requestSingleUpdate ( const gaia::base::String &  provider,
const LocationListener &  listener,
const gaia::core::Page *  srcLooper 
)

Requests a single location update from the named provider.

It may take a while to receive the most recent location. If an immediate location is required, applications may use the getLastKnownLocation(String) method.

In case the provider is disabled by the user, the update will not be received, and the LocationListener#onProviderDisabled(String) method will be called. As soon as the provider is enabled again, the LocationListener#onProviderEnabled(String) method will be called and location updates will start again.

bool gaia::connectivity::LocationManager::sendExtraCommand ( const gaia::base::String &  provider,
const gaia::base::String &  command,
const gaia::core::Persistence &  extras 
)

Sends additional commands to a location provider.

Can be used to support provider specific extensions to the Location Manager API

Parameters:
providername of the location provider.
commandname of the command to send to the provider.
extrasoptional arguments for the command (or null). The provider may optionally fill the extras Persistence with results from the command.
Returns:
true if the command succeeds.

Sets a mock enabled value for the given provider.

This value will be used in place of any actual value from the provider.

Parameters:
